meanings.definition: To buy or acquire in advance.
meanings.sent1: I am prepurchasing tickets for the movie next week.
meanings.sent2: She always prepurchases her groceries online to save time.
meanings.sent3: John joked that he was prepurchasing a time machine to skip Mondays.
meanings.sent4: By prepurchasing the latest gadget, she felt ahead of the curve.
meanings.sent5: The wise squirrel prepurchased nuts for the long winter ahead.

meanings.definition: The act of purchasing something before it is needed.
meanings.sent1: His prepurchasing of supplies ensured a smooth project completion.
meanings.sent2: The company's prepurchasing of raw materials saved them money.
meanings.sent3: The prepurchasing of umbrellas on a sunny day made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her prepurchasing of books was like building a library for the future.
meanings.sent5: The prepurchasing of concert tickets made the event unforgettable.
